name: Komichi
short_description:
NOTE: I decided that Komichi's codebase is no longer worth actively-maintaining. You're perfectly free to fork it if you want. However, my focus in Web browser development has shifted to the less-kludgy browsers http://sourceforge.net/projects/cheddar-browser/ and http://sourceforge.net/projects/ryouko/

Komichi is a fork of Seabiscuit (https://sourceforge.net/projects/biscuit-browser/). It is a simple Web browser coded in Python and PyQt. Komichi is designed to run on Linux, but it might possibly work on other Unix-like operating systems. Support for Windows and Mac is not planned at the moment (although version 0.2.5, which is presently in the Git repository, works on Windows with reduced functionality). Since it was only coded for fun, Komichi supports just a basic set of features, and is not recommended for serious usage
summary: Simple Python/PyQt Web browser for Linux
